PointSetOpen3D class¶

This class inherits from PointSet.PointSet and adds functionality (such as normals computation) via Open3D.

The class computes a KD-tree with initialization. As used in Open3D, it uses FLANN to build KDTrees for fast retrieval of nearest neighbors.

When a subset of the PointSet is required, a subclass is set use PointSubSetOpen3D class

class PointSetOpen3D.PointSetOpen3D(points, path=None, intensity=None, range_accuracy=0.002, angle_accuracy=0.012, measurement_accuracy=0.002)[source]¶

Attributes

Methods

CalculateNormals(search_radius=0.05, maxNN=20, orientation=(0.0, 0.0, 0.0), verbose=True)[source]¶

Compute normals for PointSetOpen3D according to radius and maximum neighbors, if an orientation is given, the normals are computed towards the orientation.

Parameters

  • search_radius (float) – neighbors radius for normal computation. Default: 0.05

  • maxNN (int) – maximum neighbors in a neighborhood. If set to (-1), there is no limitation. Default: 20.

  • orientation (tuple) – “camera” orientation. The orientation towards which the normals are computed. Default: (0,0,0)

  • verbose (bool) – print inter-running messages.

Returns
